data.title: Feature request: Make colons optional in GDScript
data.body:
I'd prefer skipping the end of line ":" on functions and control structures if / for /while and so on.
I think it looks neater and saves a lazy key stroke :)

data.title: Missing Godot Engine Contributors copyright line in the About box
data.body:
Currently, the about box copyright is different from what we have on the code files:

![about](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/26610610/fad329ba-457e-11e7-9967-3840cd5f1706.png)

Compared to:

```
/* Copyright (c) 2007-2017 Juan Linietsky, Ariel Manzur.                 */
/* Copyright (c) 2014-2017 Godot Engine contributors (cf. AUTHORS.md)    */
```

They should match.

data.title: Expose copy constructor for some GDNative types
data.body: This PR exposes the copy constructors of Array, Dictionary, and PoolVector for GDNative as `godot_..._new_copy`. For referencing an existing container, the copy constructor is better than `godot_..._new` followed by `operator=` because the default constructor [allocates a new empty container](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/array.cpp#L291) first.

data.title: Allow for getting/setting "dotted" properties of objects
data.body:
**Do not merge without proper review!** This might prove detrimental to `Object::get/set` performance.

Additionally includes a commit that makes it easier to use `Tween::{interpolate,targeting}_property`, by auto-`get()`-ing the initial value if `null` is given.

I'm open to discussions about better solutions, either here or on the original issue (#8257).

[GIF Recording of work](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/26603684/6afa37a4-4590-11e7-82ef-57cc1b9ab4f9.gif) (its dimensions are a bit too large, so I won't inline it here)
Code used for recording:
`main.gd`
```gdscript
extends Node2D

func _ready():
	var tween = get_node("Tween")
	tween.interpolate_property(get_node("KinematicBody2D"), "position.x", null, 500, 2, Tween.TRANS_BOUNCE, Tween.EASE_OUT, 0)
	# Without second commit:
	#tween.interpolate_property(get_node("KinematicBody2D"), "position.x", get_node("KinematicBody2D").position.x, 500, 2, Tween.TRANS_BOUNCE, Tween.EASE_OUT, 0)
	tween.start()
```
`kinematic_body_2d.gd`
```gdscript
extends KinematicBody2D

func _fixed_process(delta): # Note: 3.0, thus doesn't need set_fixed_process(true)
	move(Vector2(-50, 50) * delta)
```

As you can see, the Tween applies to the X axis only, while the Y axis is moved by the KinematicBody2D.

Closes #8257.

data.title: InputEvent: Restore old behaviour for matching key events to actions.

data.title: CanvasItemEditor: Ability to show mouse position.
data.body:
Adds the ability to show the current mouse position on top of the 2D Editor (relative to the Game viewport of course).
Can be toggled via the editor setting `editors/2d/show_mouse_position`.

Closes #6224.

![2d_mpos](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8281916/26600535/bc8d888c-457c-11e7-946f-5eceb43637ab.gif)

**Update:**
![mpos3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281916/27296897-1bf63732-5523-11e7-8eab-85ee26136535.gif)

data.title: Enabling blend split on a DirectionalLight with shadows enabled, breaks the light
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: Master 5567e898d **


**Issue description:**
Enabling Blend Split on a directional light, breaks the light.

Output says:

> ERROR: _display_error_with_code: SceneShaderGLES3: Fragment Program Compilation Failed:
> 0(1124) : error C1115: unable to find compatible overloaded function "mix(float, float)"
> 
>    At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:167.
> ERROR: get_current_version: SceneShaderGLES3: Fragment Program Compilation Failed:
> 0(1124) : error C1115: unable to find compatible overloaded function "mix(float, float)"
> 
>    At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:455.
> ERROR: get_current_version: Method/Function Failed, returning: __null
>    At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:463.

The fragment program line with the error (1124) says:

> shadow=mix(shadow, sample_shadow(directional_shadow,directional_shadow_pixel_size,pssm_coord2.xy,pssm_coord2.z,light_clamp));


**Steps to reproduce:**
Enable Shadows and Blend Split on a DirectionalLight.

This works on a late january build (I don't know if the effect is the correct one but it don't break the light).

data.title: Fix multiple 2D & 3D physics issues (2.1)
data.body:
- Use `NOTIFICATION_ENTER`/`EXIT_WORLD` for `Area` (intead of `*_TREE`).
- Now both bodies' and areas' constraints are cleaned up.
- And now also that happens as soon as the space is set to null (i.e., when exiting the tree) instead of only at freeing time.
- When clearing constraints, the loop goes on to the next if the current is already released, instead of breaking.
- When one has been already released, no error is shown from now on, as it's something expected, since a pair (our kind of constraint of interest) can be freed by any of its involved collision objects and the other will try again.
- Implement index shifting (or marking as -1) for shapes indices in collision pairs shapes are removed.
- Standarize behavior of bodies and areas so that anything that invalidates a given pair gives the same result (collision mask, actual collision, etc); for instance, triggering area enter/exit signals.
- Add missing member initializations.
- Extend the new-space-equals-area/body-current-space test to every case.
- Fix 3D ray-casts early accepting Areas (skipping the mask check).
- Fix unpairing of large elements (2D's `BroadPhase2DHashGrid`).

Some of these prevent random crashes caused by constraints with dangling pointers to involved objects.
Fixes #8856.
Fixes #7589.
Fixes #6676.
And maybe others.

~~__NOTE:__
One of the issues is fixed by #9094, so I've worked on this with that one merged so it's a dependency.~~

~~__UPDATE:__
I've started noticing an issue that can make the engine crash. Not sure if it's something directly due to my modifications or if I have uncovered a latent bug somehow. So still researching.~~

~~__UPDATE:__
What I am being hit by is #6676. So I'm trying to hunt that bug and add a fix for it to this PR.~~

~~__UPDATE:__
Now I know objects are being properly destroyed at the C++ level (AKA, the #9094 debacle), I'm looking in other places.~~

__UPDATE:__
On my part, this is ready to review and test.
Also someone should check the eligibility of some or all of these fixes for _master_ as I currently don't have the time to do it.

data.title: Fallback to embedded font for dynamic font
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All OS, All Godot version

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Letters are not visible if assigned font does not have for it after assigning a TTF.
but we have embedded font for taking care of almost all kinds of languages.
So, it will be great that character is rendered with embedded fonts if assigned custom TTF and its fallback don't have for it.

I hope 2.1 has this too.

data.title: Holding Shift seems to prevent detection of other key events
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, Godot 3 (latest)


**Issue description:**
After the new input changes I'm finding some problems with my character's movement.
It seems that when Shift is down, no other key events are detected.
If I start with Shift first, I cant even make him move. If I hold Shift after starting the movement and then releasing a movement key, the release event seems not to be fired. I need to release Shift, press the key and release it again.

data.title: CONTRIBUTING.md : formatting to 80 columns and added a little paragraph about translations
data.body:
Formatting CONTRIBUTING.md to 80 colums, like the translation README. This improve readability into terminals.
Also added a little paragraph about how to contribute to Godot's translation. Its absence lead me to submit a pull request instead of using the webapp: #8846. (The README.md into the translation folder is a little bit hidden :) )

data.title: AnimationPlayer don't memories time position in editor (red line)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Window 7, v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
Red Line from AnimationPlayer go back to 0 time after reselecting.
It looks like animation is on correct position. But you got fooled.

![animationplayer_redline_problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10463138/26563310/8413510a-44d0-11e7-8c9f-4db09cb4a56c.gif)

I expect red line should be on same place after reselecting animationplayer.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[issue_save_and_animationplayer.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1036877/issue_save_and_animationplayer.gz)

data.title: Fix saving of 2d scene
rename set_expand_margin_size to set_expand_margin
data.body:
The naming of style box variables are unnecessary long in my opinion.
a couple of names end with size:
```
set_expand_margin_size
set_margin_size
```
which is not consistent to `set_default_margin`

I would like to remove all the `_size` endings to make it consistent and faster to type.

data.title: Fixed .hdr support to compile on windows
data.body:
Added "static_cast" when calling "pow" as the windows compiler threw an error about casting.
Edit: changed from "static_cast" to writing writing 2.0f and 128.0f instead
Edit2: squashed it
Edit3: changed commit msg

data.title: Controls defined in Input Map are not saved
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint 18.1 Cinnamon x64
Godot master 8125bbb

**Issue description:**
Any keys or buttons defined under the Input Map menu are not applied or saved. 


**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a new project
- Create a new action in the Input Map menu and assign any key or button to it
- Add any node to the scene, save, and exit Godot
- Re-open your project and check the Input Map menu

Your previously-defined key/button will no longer be there.

To go a step further:
- Assign a key/button to your action again
- Add a Label node to the scene, and attach a script that reads your custom action input and changes the text accordingly
- Save and run, and press the assigned key/button

The text won't change.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[testproj.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1036489/testproj.zip)
I've created an action called "button" and assigned the J key to it, but the assignment wasn't saved so you should probably do that yourself before testing it.

data.title: overloaded functions bindings to gdScript
data.body:
overloaded functions would be nice for the GDScript api.

**how it currently works**
If I bind multiple function with the same name and different parameter footprints, I just overwrite the previous binding.
 
use case example: #8981

data.title: X11: Turn warning about not finding cursor theme into verbose output.
data.body:
Failing to get the cursor theme should not cause any issues since we're then using the default one anyway.
So I removed the warning and made it a verbose-only print instead, as people tend to mistake it for a real error.. (pretty much like `iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile` :P)

data.title: Objects not automatically freed when loaded from script
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 8.1 -  Godot 2.1.x


**Issue description:**
When a variable is loaded via **load("res://some_script.gd").new()**, or **SomeObject.new()** it is not automatically freed when quitting the application, and there is an error message when closing the game window :
```
ERROR: SelfList<class GDFunction>::List::~List: Condition ' _first != 0 ' is true.
   At: core\self_list.h:80
ERROR: SelfList<class GDScript>::List::~List: Condition ' _first != 0 ' is true.

   At: core\self_list.h:80
WARNING: ObjectDB::cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
     At: core\object.cpp:1845
ERROR: ResourceCache::clear: Resources Still in use at Exit!
   At: core\resource.cpp:378
```
or:
```
WARNING: ObjectDB::cleanup: ObjectDB Instances still exist!
     At: core\object.cpp:1845

```
![godot bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13215043/26558904/58bbcae2-44ac-11e7-9f2d-070766cec629.png)



**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene with a root Node and attach a script
2. Write this piece of code in the scene's script:
```gdscript
extends Node

var object_from_script
var other_object

func _ready():
	object_from_script = load("res://some_script.gd").new()
	other_object = Node.new()
```
To try the bug with **object_from_script**, you need to create the script first, you can keep the default code in it. To test the two errors (see image), comment one of the two lines in the _ready() function.

3. Launch and quit the game (do NOT stop the scene from the editor)

**How to avoid the error until it is fixed:**
The only way I found to avoid the problem in my code is to add this piece of code:
```gdscript
 func _exit_tree():
	object_from_script.free()
	other_object.free()
```
As objects created from the editors are automatically freed, I think this is a real bug.
If it is a wanted behaviour, I'd like to know a less redondant way to avoid it ;)

**Link to minimal example project:**
Here is the test project I used:
[bug report.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1036449/bug.report.zip)

data.title: Custom Signal variables do not show up in editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0

**Issue description:**
When you create a custom signal on a script - it does not show indicate it take in any variables from within the editor.

This is somewhat related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6120 - but for the editor view. :)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create script with signal - that takes in variables.
Go to editor and check the Node -> Signals tab for the custom script.

There should be a variable, but nothing is shown.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/26548236/72e46d7c-4473-11e7-9976-a80c331dabf1.png)

data.title: [2.1] Enhanced debugger
data.body:
**Edited**

Refector debug related code to allow full access to variables to imporve develop experience.

- [x] Access more kind of properties from remote debugger
- [x] Change GDInstance to make it possiable to access script members with property list
- [x] Query Multiple remote object with debbger with better `ScriptEditorDebuggerInspectedObject`
- [x] Serialize/Unserialize informations accessed from `ScriptDebuggerRemot`e to `ScriptEditorDebugger`
- [x] Serialize dictionary variables from debugger remote  and unserialize them
- [x] Implements dictionary property editor
- [x] Battle test with real game projects in my company

![Screen Recoder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6964556/26554826/c7a0d1ec-44c4-11e7-9549-3a6403477ad8.gif)

data.body:

This is how it will sort now: https://gist.github.com/noshyaar/182fb8e88262a6123b3c0e120a8d84f2

[natural sort of files/folders start with a .]
[natural sort of files/folders]

data.title: Fixed a Typo in the Visual Server
data.body:
The file servers/visual/rasterizer.h and its cpp file had the typo _signleton_. I changed it to _singleton_.
p.s: The typo didn't really hurt anything.
